If there's a crown jewel of downtown's recent revival, it's probably Campus Martius. The public park located at Detroit's point of origin has become the beating heart of the city since its rededication in 2004, featuring world-class entertainment and year-round events. 
But despite the introduction of a head-turning urban "beach" and cafe during the summer months, the one amenity absent from the space has been a top-notch fine-dining restaurant for celebratory date nights and high-powered business lunches. 
That changed in November, when Parc opened in the former Fountain Bistro locale just in time for the flurry of holiday activities. Buy Photo 
Parc, in downtown Detroit's Campus Martius Park, is designed by Chicago-based Knauer Incorporated and by Detroit-based Neumann/Smith Architecture. (Photo: Mark Kurlyandchik, Detroit Free Press) 
With its 270-degree view of the park and city thanks to floor-to-ceiling Nana glass windows that open in warmer months, Parc has quickly established itself as a place to see and be seen. 
The glitzy setting, classy service and extensive wine list get plenty of attention, but Parc wouldn't be what it is without the talents of executive chef Jordan Hoffman and his team, who create stunning plates like the almost too pretty to eat yellowtail carpaccio. 2017 Restaurant of the Year
